info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 9:54AM CDT until June 13 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall has occurred. Additional heavy rain is not expected for the next few hours.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Louisiana, including the following parishes, in south central Louisiana, Iberia, Lafayette and St. Martin. In southwest Louisiana, Vermilion.
* WHEN...Until 100 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Several structures are flooded and some sand bagging operations are continuing.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 949 AM CDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to Ongoing Flooding. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional heavy rainfall will be possible in the afternoon, hence another flash flood warning might be possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lafayette, New Iberia, Abbeville, Breaux Bridge, St. Martinville, Broussard, Youngsville, Erath, Delcambre, Maurice, Cade, Coteau, Acadiana Regional Airport, Jefferson Island, Parks and Milton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING

area.areaDesc: Iberia, LA; Lafayette, LA; St. Martin, LA; Vermilion, LA
